page.title: 15The Devil's Stone,Cortachy
page.content: In the{River South Esk}by{Cortachy {Church}is a huge boulder known locally as the{Devil's}Stone.There are two stories as to how it came to be there. The first one is that the{Devil}was angry with{the minister}for continually preaching that the Devil's way was wrong and so he hurled the huge stone from nearby{Tulloch {Hill}hoping to kill him.Apparently he missed and the stone crashed into the river. The second version says the stone was thrown by the Devil,angry at the building of an earlier church on the present site.Again he missed. Another odd thing about the stone is that people swear that if it is submerged by the river,a member of the {Airlie}family will die.
